books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A classic novel depicting the decadence of the American Dream during the Roaring Twenties.

books.author: Frank Herbert
books.description: A science fiction masterpiece set in a distant future amidst political intrigue, giant sandworms, and interstellar travel.

books.author: Dan Brown
books.description: A gripping mystery thriller involving hidden secrets, symbolism, and a race against time to solve a murder.

books.author: Walter Isaacson
books.description: An in-depth biography of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs, chronicling his life, career, and impact on technology.

books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A classic fantasy trilogy that follows the epic journey to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

books.author: Markus Zusak
books.description: Set in Nazi Germany, this novel narrated by Death tells the story of a young girl's relationship with her foster parents, the other residents of their neighborhood, and a Jewish fist-fighter.

books.author: Carl Sagan
books.description: A popular science book exploring the universe and our place in it, written by the renowned astrophysicist Carl Sagan.

books.author: Gillian Flynn
books.description: A psychological thriller that explores the complexities of a marriage and the disappearance of the wife on their fifth wedding anniversary.

books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A timeless classic novel that explores themes of love, class, and societal expectations in 19th-century England.

books.book_name: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: An exploration of the history of Homo sapiens, from the emergence of our species to the present day, examining the impact of cultural, political, and technological developments.
